page.title: 15THE LOCAL ENVIRONMENT
page.content: The area is one of great natural beauty with its sweeping chalk hills, wide open farmland and meadows and generous woodland. There is a great abundance of wildlife and we found many varieties of wild flowers during our walks including some beautiful orchids. Lizards and snakes are regularly seen and slow-worms are common visitors to the school. The area is criss-crossed by many bridle-ways and footpaths, the most famous being the Pilgrim's Way, and many walkers visit the area to sample the magnificent views from the downs. Horse riding is also a very popular local pastime. Many of the footpaths lead into almost impenetrable woods where there are numerous pheasant runs and many "interesting" finds to be made such as ancient abandoned farm machinery and old bottles.
